Class Pile

java.lang.Object
edu.wit.scds.ds.lists.app.card_game.universal_base.pile.PileBase
edu.wit.scds.ds.lists.app.card_game.standard_cards.pile.Pile
All Implemented Interfaces:
Iterable<CardBase>
Direct Known Subclasses:
Deck, DiscardPile, DiscardPile, Hand, Hand, Meld, Meld, Stock, Stock
public abstract class Pile extends PileBase
Representation of a pile of standard playing cards

the top card is at position 0

Version:
1.0 2025-06-26 extracted standard playing card-specific methods from Pile, 2.0 2025-07-11
  • track changes to previous common package, now universal_base
  • rename from StandardPile to Pile
, 2.1 2025-11-19 extend functionality to support deck validation
Author:
Dave Rosenberg

    • DEFAULT_CARD_ORIENTATION

      private static final Orientation DEFAULT_CARD_ORIENTATION
      by default, cards added to this pile will be turned face down

  • Constructor Details

    • Pile

      protected Pile()
      Initialize the pile with cards placed face down by default

    • Pile

      protected Pile(Orientation initialOrientation)
      Initialize the pile with cards placed face up/down as specified by default
      Parameters:
      initialOrientation - specify whether cards will be face up or down by default

  • Method Details

    • getCardLike

      public Card getCardLike(CardBase likeCard)
      Description copied from class: PileBase
      Retrieve a specific card from the pile by card - the card is not removed from the pile

      Caution: the returned card should only be in one pile at any time

      Overrides:
      getCardLike in class PileBase
      Parameters:
      likeCard - a placeholder - usually is a throw-away instance used for lookup only, not game play
      Returns:
      the specified card or null if the card isn't in the pile

    • getCardLike

      public Card getCardLike(Rank rank, Suit suit)
      Retrieve a specific card from the pile by card - the card is not removed from the pile
      Parameters:
      rank - the rank of the desired card
      suit - the suit of the desired card
      Returns:
      the specified card or null if the card isn't in the pile

      Description copied from class: PileBase
      Remove a specific card from the pile by position
      Overrides:
      removeCardAt in class PileBase
      Parameters:
      position - the 0-based position of the card in the pile where 0 is the bottom of the pile
      Returns:

    • removeTopCard

      public Card removeTopCard()
      Description copied from class: PileBase
      Remove the top card from the pile

      Note: there is no corresponding convenience method to remove the bottom card since that's usually cheating and we can't condone that 8~)

      Overrides:
      removeTopCard in class PileBase
      Returns:
      the top card
